trans-unit.source: Creating a B2B process in Microsoft Azure App Service
trans-unit.target: Creating a B2B process in Microsoft Azure App Service

trans-unit.source: Overview to create a Business-to-Business Process
trans-unit.target: Overview to create a Business-to-Business Process

trans-unit.source: Creating a B2B process
trans-unit.target: Creating a B2B process

trans-unit.source: Business Scenario
trans-unit.target: Business Scenario

trans-unit.source: Contoso and Northwind are two business partners.
trans-unit.target: Contoso and Northwind are two business partners.

trans-unit.source: Contoso (the retailer) sends purchase orders to Northwind (the supplier) over an industry level transport such as AS2.
trans-unit.target: Contoso (the retailer) sends purchase orders to Northwind (the supplier) over an industry level transport such as AS2.

trans-unit.source: Northwind stores all incoming orders in its Cloud storage.
trans-unit.target: Northwind stores all incoming orders in its Cloud storage.

trans-unit.source: The purchase orders are XML messages between these two partners.
trans-unit.target: The purchase orders are XML messages between these two partners.

trans-unit.source: Once the message is stored in Northwind's cloud storage then Northwind's internal processes handle the order from that point on.
trans-unit.target: Once the message is stored in Northwind's cloud storage then Northwind's internal processes handle the order from that point on.

trans-unit.source: The objective of this tutorial is to establish how Northwind can establish a business process via which it can receive messages (purchase orders in XML) from its partner Contoso over AS2 and then persist it in its Cloud storage.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this tutorial is to establish how Northwind can establish a business process via which it can receive messages (purchase orders in XML) from its partner Contoso over AS2 and then persist it in its Cloud storage.

trans-unit.source: Capabilities demonstrated
trans-unit.target: Capabilities demonstrated

trans-unit.source: This tutorial helps showcase the following capabilities:
trans-unit.target: This tutorial helps showcase the following capabilities:

trans-unit.source: **Message transportation**: The retailer and supplier can be on different platforms but they can still achieve communication between the two.
trans-unit.target: **Message transportation**: The retailer and supplier can be on different platforms but they can still achieve communication between the two.

trans-unit.source: In this tutorial they are communicating over AS2 (Applicability Statement 2).
trans-unit.target: In this tutorial they are communicating over AS2 (Applicability Statement 2).

trans-unit.source: AS2 is a popular way to transport data between trading partners in business-to-business communications.
trans-unit.target: AS2 is a popular way to transport data between trading partners in business-to-business communications.

trans-unit.source: **Data persistence**: Once the message has been received over AS2 then Northwind wants to persist it before further processing.
trans-unit.target: **Data persistence**: Once the message has been received over AS2 then Northwind wants to persist it before further processing.

trans-unit.source: It can use a connector to persist messages in its Cloud storage.
trans-unit.target: It can use a connector to persist messages in its Cloud storage.

trans-unit.source: In this tutorial Azure Blobs is being leveraged as the cloud storage for Northwind.
trans-unit.target: In this tutorial Azure Blobs is being leveraged as the cloud storage for Northwind.

trans-unit.source: **Creating a business process**: In a flow, multiple API apps can be stitched together to achieve a business outcome as demonstrated here.
trans-unit.target: **Creating a business process**: In a flow, multiple API apps can be stitched together to achieve a business outcome as demonstrated here.

trans-unit.source: Before you begin
trans-unit.target: Before you begin

trans-unit.source: This tutorial assumes that you have a basic understanding of Azure App Services, know how to create API apps and stitch a flow together.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial assumes that you have a basic understanding of Azure App Services, know how to create API apps and stitch a flow together.

trans-unit.source: Steps to achieve the business scenario
trans-unit.target: Steps to achieve the business scenario

trans-unit.source: Create and configure the required API apps
trans-unit.target: Create and configure the required API apps

trans-unit.source: Create an instance of the **Azure Storage Blob Connector**.
trans-unit.target: Create an instance of the **Azure Storage Blob Connector**.

trans-unit.source: This requires the credentials to an Azure Storage account.
trans-unit.target: This requires the credentials to an Azure Storage account.

trans-unit.source: Ensure that it is ready before you start creating this.
trans-unit.target: Ensure that it is ready before you start creating this.

trans-unit.source: Create an instance of the **BizTalk Trading Partner Management**.
trans-unit.target: Create an instance of the **BizTalk Trading Partner Management**.

trans-unit.source: This requires a blank SQL Database to function.
trans-unit.target: This requires a blank SQL Database to function.

trans-unit.source: Make sure that it is ready before you start creating this.
trans-unit.target: Make sure that it is ready before you start creating this.

trans-unit.source: Create an instance of the **AS2 Connector**.
trans-unit.target: Create an instance of the **AS2 Connector**.

trans-unit.source: This also requires a blank SQL Database to function.
trans-unit.target: This also requires a blank SQL Database to function.

trans-unit.source: Make sure that it is ready before you start creating this.
trans-unit.target: Make sure that it is ready before you start creating this.

trans-unit.source: Additionally, if you want to archive messages as part of AS2 processing, you may provide credentials to an Azure Blob during its creation.
trans-unit.target: Additionally, if you want to archive messages as part of AS2 processing, you may provide credentials to an Azure Blob during its creation.

trans-unit.source: Configure the TPM (Trading Partner Management) service that is created:
trans-unit.target: Configure the TPM (Trading Partner Management) service that is created:

trans-unit.source: Browse to the instance of the TPM service created as part of the above steps.
trans-unit.target: Browse to the instance of the TPM service created as part of the above steps.

trans-unit.source: Use the **Partners** option under *Components* to **Add** a new partner named **Contoso** and in its profile add the required AS2 identity.
trans-unit.target: Use the **Partners** option under *Components* to **Add** a new partner named **Contoso** and in its profile add the required AS2 identity.

trans-unit.source: Use the **Partners** option under *Components* to **Add** a new partner named **Northwind** and in its profile add the required AS2 identity.
trans-unit.target: Use the **Partners** option under *Components* to **Add** a new partner named **Northwind** and in its profile add the required AS2 identity.

trans-unit.source: Use the **Agreements** option under *Components* to **Add** a new AS2 agreement between Northwind and Contoso.
trans-unit.target: Use the **Agreements** option under *Components* to **Add** a new AS2 agreement between Northwind and Contoso.

trans-unit.source: Northwind will be the hosted partner here, and Contoso will be the guest partner.
trans-unit.target: Northwind will be the hosted partner here, and Contoso will be the guest partner.

trans-unit.source: As appropriate configure signing, encryption, compression, and acknowledgements during this agreement creation.
trans-unit.target: As appropriate configure signing, encryption, compression, and acknowledgements during this agreement creation.

trans-unit.source: In case certificates need to be used, they can be uploaded via the **Certificates** option when browsing the TPM service that is created.
trans-unit.target: In case certificates need to be used, they can be uploaded via the **Certificates** option when browsing the TPM service that is created.

trans-unit.source: Create a flow / business process
trans-unit.target: Create a flow / business process

trans-unit.source: Create a new flow in which the first step is AS2.
trans-unit.target: Create a new flow in which the first step is AS2.

trans-unit.source: Drag and drop the **AS2 Connector** and choose the instance already created.
trans-unit.target: Drag and drop the **AS2 Connector** and choose the instance already created.

trans-unit.source: Choose trigger as the functionality
trans-unit.target: Choose trigger as the functionality

trans-unit.source: Next drag and drop **Azure Storage Blob Connector** and choose the instance already created.
trans-unit.target: Next drag and drop **Azure Storage Blob Connector** and choose the instance already created.

trans-unit.source: Choose action as the functionality and within that select Upload Blob as the desired functionality.
trans-unit.target: Choose action as the functionality and within that select Upload Blob as the desired functionality.

trans-unit.source: Configure as appropriate
trans-unit.target: Configure as appropriate

trans-unit.source: Now create/deploy the flow
trans-unit.target: Now create/deploy the flow

trans-unit.source: Message Processing & Troubleshooting
trans-unit.target: Message Processing & Troubleshooting

trans-unit.source: It is time to test out the flow we have deployed.
trans-unit.target: It is time to test out the flow we have deployed.

trans-unit.source: Send XML messages wrapped in AS2 (as per the AS2 agreement created above) to the AS2 endpoint surfaced by the AS2Connector instance that was created.
trans-unit.target: Send XML messages wrapped in AS2 (as per the AS2 agreement created above) to the AS2 endpoint surfaced by the AS2Connector instance that was created.

trans-unit.source: You may need to configure the authentication for the endpoint so that it is publicly accessible.
trans-unit.target: You may need to configure the authentication for the endpoint so that it is publicly accessible.

trans-unit.source: Execution information about the flow is surfaced by browsing to the flow and then stepping into the flow instance which got executed
trans-unit.target: Execution information about the flow is surfaced by browsing to the flow and then stepping into the flow instance which got executed

trans-unit.source: For AS2 processing information, browse to the AS2Connector instance involved, and then follow by stepping into the Tracking part.
trans-unit.target: For AS2 processing information, browse to the AS2Connector instance involved, and then follow by stepping into the Tracking part.

trans-unit.source: You can use the filters involved to restrict the view to the information that is desired.
trans-unit.target: You can use the filters involved to restrict the view to the information that is desired.

trans-unit.source: test
trans-unit.target: test
